pt: {sc}merry{/sc} {sc}blithe{/sc} {sc}jocund{/sc} {sc}jovial{/sc} {sc}jolly{/sc} mean showing high spirits or lightheartedness. {sc}merry{/sc} suggests cheerful, joyous, uninhibited enjoyment of frolic or festivity.
{sc}blithe{/sc} suggests carefree, innocent, or even heedless gaiety.

pt.t: arrived late in his usual {it}blithe{/it} way

pt: {sc}jocund{/sc} stresses elation and exhilaration of spirits.
{sc}jovial{/sc} suggests the stimulation of conviviality and good fellowship.

pt.t: dinner put them in a {it}jovial{/it} mood

pt: {sc}jolly{/sc} suggests high spirits expressed in laughing, bantering, and jesting.

quotes.t: I felt I was slumming, in my own life. My task was to ward off the drivel … the {qword}jovial{/qword} claptrap of classmates and teachers, the maddening bromides I heard at home.
For, the people who were shovelling away on the housetops were {qword}jovial{/qword} and full of glee; calling out to one another from the parapets, and now and then exchanging a facetious snowball …
In response, an infuriating wink: Alsana always likes to appear {qword}jovial{/qword} at the very moment that her interlocutor becomes hot under the collar.

shortdef: characterized by good-humored cheerfulness and conviviality : jolly
